author: Staff Reporter
text:
Thanking Prime Minister Narendra Modi for launching ‘Startup India’, Tamil Nadu Small and Tiny Industries Association (TANSTIA) has said that the scheme would convert the job seekers into job providers.

In a press release, its vice president K. Mariappan said that the new scheme will guide entrepreneurs to start new units and contribute for the economy.

The Atal Innovation Mission will give an impetus to innovation. By conducting core innovation programmes in five lakh schools, entrepreneurship skills will be taught to the students, he said.

Incubators

The proposal to start new incubators, research parks and bio-clusters will generate thousands of skilled workers across the country. The association also welcomed the government’s aim to bring a Bankruptcy Law in the next Parliament session by which the exit plan for the industrial units resulting in avoiding delays in the insolvency proceedings in the country and the consequent fall in the company assets value will be avoided.

The association also said that income tax exemption and nil inspection of factories under the scheme will encourage more entrepreneurs to start units.
title: TANSTIA hails ‘Startup India’ initiative
